alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until noon EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas and farm fields between Grand Isle and Van Buren. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1059 PM EDT, The public and New Brunswick Power officials reported several ice jams between Van Buren upstream to Lille. Minor flooding is already occurring in the farm fields and low lying areas along the river with water rising. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Van Buren, Lille, Grand Isle and Hamlin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
